FILE: cm800820v11.0.txt
DYAD: Thailand-Malaysia

PSNOTES: 

PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20170521
PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20170521

Territorial-Maritime-Boundary Issues Variables

MID4559

TERRMID: MID4559 3 -- not territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID4559 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID4559 from narrative, following an arms heist in Malaysia by Thai rebels, Malaysia increased the number of border guards along the border with Thailand. Some of the guards crossed into Thai territory and were captured but soon released. Coded not territorial because, although soldiers were arrested for violating the sovereignty of Thailand, the dispute does not concern territory. 

TERRLINK: MID4559 3 -- not third party linked to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4559 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID4559 

MARITMID: MID4559 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4559 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID4559 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4559 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES:

CIVWARMID: MID4559 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4559 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID4559 Rebels in Thailand performed a heist which led to the events that make up MID4559. Although this MID was not coded as territorial, the civil unrest in Thailand still led to a MID, so coded civil war MID. 

CIVWARLINK: MID4559 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4559 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID: MID4559 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID4559 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID4559 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4559 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4570

TERRMID: MID4570 3 -- not territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID4570 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID4570 from narrative, civil unrest in Thailand prompted Malaysia to increase border troops to prevent spillover, triggering a MID. Coded non-territorial because border troops were not intended as an aggressive act toward Thailand's government. 

TERRLINK: MID4570 3 -- not third party linked to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4570 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES:

MARITMID: MID4570 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4570 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES:

ISLMID: MID4570 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4570 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES:

CIVWARMID: MID4570 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4570 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID4570 from narrative, civil unrest in Thailand led to Malaysia increasing border troops, triggering this MID. 

CIVWARLINK: MID4570 3 -- not civil war link
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4570 1 -- certain
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID-CER: MID4570 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES:

COUPLINK-CER: MID4570 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4572

TERRMID: MID4572 1 -- territorial MID
TERRMID-CER: MID4572 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID4572 from BBC, Thailand arrested 6 Malaysian soldiers who crossed into Thailand. Coded not territorial since, although they were arrested for violating Thailand's sovereignty, Thailand believed it was possible that the crossing was an accident. The dispute also does not seem to concern contested territory.

TERRLINK: MID4572 3 -- not third party linked to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4572 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES:

MARITMID: MID4572 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4572 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES:

ISLMID: MID4572 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4572 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES:

CIVWARMID: MID4572 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4572 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID4572 From BBC, Thailand had been fighting a secessionist rebel group movement for decades along the border area with Malaysia, prompting high alert and patrols by Thailand border guards. Thailand arrested Malaysian guards who had crossed the border in this area. 

CIVWARLINK: MID4572 3 -- not civil war link
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4572 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID: MID4572 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID4572 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID4572 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4572 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4 2002-2010:

MID4559
rivalry=800820 nationa=MALAYSIA nationb=THAILAND MID4559 20040104-20041030 
 revtype1a=NOT APPLICABLE revtype2a=NOT APPLICABLE fatala=NONE fatalpa=0 lhosta=DISPLAY OF FORCE 
 revtype1b=NOT APPLICABLE revtype2b=NOT APPLICABLE fatalb=NONE fatalpb=
0 lhostb=USE OF FORCE 

Following an arms heist by rebels from Thailand, Malaysia increased its border forces along the Malaysia-Thailand border to prevent further incursions. Apparently, some of these additional soldiers crossed over into Thai territory, and were captured, but later released, by Thai military forces. First day of dispute was on 1/4/2004 and last day of dispute was on 10/30/2004.

MID4570
rivalry=800820 nationa=MALAYSIA nationb=THAILAND MID4570 20050922-20051022 
 revtype1a=NOT APPLICABLE revtype2a=NOT APPLICABLE fatala=NONE fatalpa=0 lhosta=DISPLAY OF FORCE 
 revtype1b=NOT APPLICABLE revtype2b=NOT APPLICABLE fatalb=NONE fatalpb=
0 lhostb=NO MILITARIZED ACTION 

Civil disturbances in southern Thailand prompted Malaysia to deploy additional troops to prevent any conflict spillover into Malaysian territory. First day of dispute was on 9/22/2005 and last day of dispute was on 10/22/2005.

MID4572
rivalry=800820 nationa=MALAYSIA nationb=THAILAND MID4572 20060220-20060820 
 revtype1a=NOT APPLICABLE revtype2a=NOT APPLICABLE fatala=NONE fatalpa=0 lhosta=DISPLAY OF FORCE 
 revtype1b=NOT APPLICABLE revtype2b=NOT APPLICABLE fatalb=NONE fatalpb=
0 lhostb=USE OF FORCE 

The Thai military detained six Malaysian soldiers who crossed into Thailand. It is unclear when, or if, the soldiers were released. First day of dispute was on 2/20/2006 and last day of dispute was on 8/20/2006.

Sources

"Malaysia reports detention of six "soldiers" in southern Thailand." BBC Monitoring Asia Pacific-Political. Found via LexisNexis 2/8/2017. Article in MID Documentation folder.
